CatDescriptText: Mr. Percy Banks, 104 Sylvania Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 21, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that the proposed six-day-a-week school attendance, as proposed by Governor Leader, is the answer to the Russian challenge in scientific education?" answer reads: "No, I do not. I think that the emphasis to catch up with Russia should be on the college level.  Five days a week is enough to go to school.  With this, the children should be able to pick up what they want to do.  Then science should take its course."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Percy Banks, wearing hat, eyeglasses, striped knit scarf, and herringbone coat, standing in front of light colored marble pillar between windows displaying signs reading "Mutual Fund Center", "Can You Pick Tomorrows Winners? Dow - Jones Industrial Stocks", and "Guild"

date: 104 Sylvania Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 21, 1957
cutline: No, I do not. I think that the emphasis to catch up with Russia should be on the college level.  Five days a week is enough to go to school.  With this, the children should be able to pick up what they want to do.  Then science should take its course.
